responses.rationale: Reports a discovery, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes actions being taken ('will be slaughtered and buried', 'exports... will be restricted') which are response measures/safeguards.
Reports a past action/result, not a current capability or preparedness measure.
Provides background data, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Reports a past event, not a current capability or preparedness measure.
Reports a past event, not a current capability or preparedness measure.
Reports events and actions in other locations, not describing a specific capability or preparedness measure of the reporting entity.
Describes an action being taken ('will cull nearly 140,000 turkey and chickens') which is a response measure/safeguard.
Reports a fact about the infection history.
Reports a fact about spread.
Describes a planned action/decision process ('authorities would decide on possible culling there in due course') which is a response measure/safeguard.
Reports a consequence/fact.
Reports an ongoing measure ('Chickens have been in bird flu lockdown') which is a safeguard.
Reports a requirement/fact resulting from measures.
Describes a planned action ('supermarkets will put up signs') and a future possibility ('eggs will go back to being free-range').
Describes the purpose of a safeguard ('temporarily housed to protect their health and welfare').
Describes a future possibility ('birds will be able to go outside again').
Describes a development capability/measure ('France has been trialling bird flu vaccines').
States a goal/purpose ('Protect health and welfare') related to safeguards.
Reports a reaction ('raised concerns'), not a capability or preparedness measure.
Reports facts about outbreaks.
Reports facts about the virus spread.
Contains potential Q5 Reassuring cues ('stressed that the virus has already been well studied').
Reports a reaction ('raises our concern level') and a consequence/recommendation, not a capability/preparedness statement.
States knowledge, capability, and preparedness ('known to us', 'studying it', 'preparing for avian flu for 20 years').
Reports a characteristic/fact about the virus.
Reports detection locations (facts).
Reports scale of impact and a response action as a factual event, not describing the safeguard system itself.
Reports a finding (fact).
Reports a finding (fact).
Reports historical fact.
Reports historical facts/statistics.
Reports a specific past event/case.
Reports facts about a specific case outcome.
Reports a finding/diagnosis (fact).
Reports facts about a specific case outcome.
Provides general information about symptoms (fact).
Provides general information about symptoms/outcomes (fact).
Reports historical fact.
Reports a reaction ('concerning'), not a capability or preparedness statement.
States the lack of a certain type of protection/capability.
Reports a reaction ('concern') and potential future impact, not a capability/preparedness statement.
Describes potential future consequences/impacts, not a capability/preparedness statement.
Reports current situation and background facts, not a capability/preparedness statement.
States a resource/capability ('estimated 310 million egg-laying hens') without explicit calming language.
Reports an action taken by another country ('Colombia has restricted the import') which is a safeguard/restriction.
Provides background data (fact).
Reports details of a restriction ('the ban includes beef products') which is a safeguard.
Reports an action taken by another country ('Colombia imposed temporary restrictions') which is a safeguard/restriction.
Describes a potential consequence of the restrictions/safeguards.
Describes a planned action/requirement ('will require dairy cattle... to be tested') which is a safeguard/response measure.
States the purpose of measures ('aim to contain the spread') which are safeguards.
Reports a specific case (fact).
Expresses an opinion and states a consequence, not a capability/preparedness statement.
Describes an action being taken ('officials are talking with Colombia') which is a response/diplomacy measure.
Reports a request for information (fact).
Describes an action being taken ('We are responding to their requests') which is a response/information sharing measure.
Reports a lack of information (fact).
Reports a call for action/resource ('call for international funding to help stop the disease spreading') related to future capability/preparedness.
Describes a condition related to future capability/preparedness ('unless international funding is secured').
Reports actions taken ('Teams... have buried hundreds of dead birds') which are response measures.
Reports a process ('after analysing samples') which is part of surveillance/response capability.
Comments on the complexity of capabilities ('surveillance and control by good field workers').
States a limitation on resources/capability ('have limited conservation funds').
Describes how resources/capabilities are funded ('rely on international funding... to pay for the services of local park staff').
States the importance of a type of response/capability ('Rapid reaction is critical').
Describes the need for resources/capability ('having staff on the ground with the resources... is essential') and reports an action taken to secure resources ('secured temporary funds').
Reports an action taken ('has written to ask... to help fund the surveillance and disposal') related to capabilities/safeguards.
Characterizes the situation ('management of a global pandemic') and makes a recommendation related to resources/capability ('should at least be offering assistance to those with less resources').
Characterizes the difficulty of a response measure ('minimising spread of infection is a big task').
Reports findings (facts).
Expresses personal difficulty and sadness, not a capability/preparedness statement.
